title: AngularJs
description: Good framework but have a lot of issues and it's really old, if you use it, change it.

title: Angular 2
description: My preferite framework for frontend, it guides you through the most difficult tasks, a lot of peoples says that it's 'too strict' but i like not having to rebuild the wheel or risking inifite loops in component rendering.
usage: Aruba shop, client area and intranet

title: NodeJs and express
description: A nice way to build a flexible back end, it become 'a good way' when you use it with typescript.

title: Asp .Net MVC5
description: Not bad, a big improvement from web form but i'm a big fan of only Js in front and let the backend do only backend stuff.

title: Asp.NET core MVC + razor pages
description: A much better project structure then MVC5 and it feels smoother.

title: CSS
description: Not fan of big and weird animation, i'm from the school "the less the better".

title: HTML
description: Literally the foundation of my job.

title: JS
description: The language improved a ton during the last years.

title: MySQL
description: Used only on a superficial level, can't say anything on this one

title: PHP
description: Used only on a superficial level, can't say anything on this one but it feels a lot easier then a c# backend

title: JQuery
description: For the times where jquery was the main js library it was really the best.

title: Wordpress
description: A good time saver for certain projects

title: Github
description: Nothing to say on this one i love it
usage: All of my project are on github

title: React
description: Good for medium size projects, but can be a little dispersive.

title: Web component & Stencil.Js
description: A lot of potential but until it can replace all the js frameworks it's still going to be underused
